body: Davide, As I understand it, EnergyPlus does not have a special type of material for this case but, if I were you, I would model it as a custom triple-pane window with really massive thick glass material for the center pane that has properties that match those of water.  Use the HB Glass material for this: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/5GMft5nqv7A9BH*RGamtqdemwGjqKjnHX7pjdv7Ucx1S7JNORa8JYR7aYEpvS8y7jVD3e2D5ls0QKsMmBtHYAjUWSU6e3zwu/GlassMaterial.JPG) You won't capture any of the convective behavior that the water might exhibit but it will give you an idea of what a massive transparent wall might do to the thermal performance of the building. As is the case with any good and open simulation tools, the limit of what you can do with it is just a function of how willing you are to get deeper into the model assumptions and how large of a margin of error you are willing to accept with certain behaviors. -Chris
